> > @gongzh021 You may need to upgrade to the latest server version, as not all server versions support disabling SSL.
> 
> I would like to ask, is this a problem only in the new version, or is this a problem in all versions?

This is theoretically an issue that only appears in relatively old server and client versions, and currently most of them are seen on Windows platforms.

> It seems stuck on the lock operation when getting the lock of the Rocketmq `store` folder. Try to check the store folder, '{user.home}/store` by default.
@HScarb  it is deployed on k8s, and the mounted directories are all isolated from each other, so the lock files will not be read by multiple brokers.  The current confusion is that FileChannelImpl. trylock is non-blocking, and if the lock already exists, it will immediately cause an exception or return null.  However, in reality, it has been blocked on this method.

Good catch! I will assign this issue to you.

Hi @lizhanhui, I have completed the modification. Moving the serialization operation outside the lock for general messages (messages not related to BCQ and LMQ) is simple, and this is the solution implemented in version 4.x. However, since LMQ and BCQ were introduced after version 5.0, they need to overwrite the queueOffset-related properties during putting message, which caused the current changes. Therefore, for these two types of messages (BCQ and LMQ), when serializing outside the lock, the properties are not written, and properties are serialized  and written after the queueOffset is truly determined in lock. This also makes the append process somewhat complicated. I have done some testing and it is currently running normally. Plz feel free to review.
@fujian-zfj Yes, we should persist confirmOffset and ensure that the message of dispatch does not exceed the confirmOffset when recovering.

> why need load authentication implementation when aclEnable=false

If we need to customize authentication based on AccessValidator, we need to load it in advance. Customize authentication need to be load even if aclEnable is false . The default implement will take effect only when aclEnable is true.

If aclEnable is false, the customize authentication will not be load in current code.

6888 is Listen port for single broker， And 10911,10912 is Cluster Port。
![Snipaste_2023-04-24_23-46-06](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25542662/234048799-c551ad00-34a5-4440-bfd7-fe7af842a320.png)

> The default listenPort of the broker in Rocketmq is 6888, which is not 10911 on the official document, resulting in abnormal communication between services

@fengcharly If you are not starting the broker in Container mode (which is often not the case), the default port for startup is 10911 and the parameter used is listenePort in NettyServerConfig.
https://github.com/apache/rocketmq/blob/14ad16b0d5e5ac770cf00660d8570d74a0a8a150/broker/src/main/java/org/apache/rocketmq/broker/BrokerStartup.java#L89
